goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This tells us how many flights are delayed and by how much time. It can help us identify patterns and trends in flight delays.

goals.question: What is the average flight time for different airlines?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of airline vs. average flight time
goals.rationale: This can help us compare the performance of different airlines in terms of flight time and identify which airlines are faster or slower.

goals.question: What is the relationship between flight distance and fuel consumption?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. fuel_consumed
goals.rationale: This can help us understand how much fuel is consumed for different flight distances and identify any patterns or outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations by reason?
goals.rationale: This can help us understand the main reasons for flight cancellations and identify any trends or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays by day of the week?
goals.visualization: Box plot of day_of_week vs. departure_delay
goals.rationale: This can help us understand if there are any specific days of the week when flights are more likely to be delayed and by how much time.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['departure_delay'], bins=50, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Flights')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    # Calculate average flight time for each airline
    avg_flight_time = data.groupby('airline')['flight_time'].mean()
    
    # Create bar chart
    ax = avg_flight_time.plot(kind='bar')
    
    # Rotate x-axis labels if necessary
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.xticks(rotation=45)
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.title("What is the average flight time for different airlines?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['distance'], data['fuel_consumed'])
    plt.xlabel('Distance')
    plt.ylabel('Fuel Consumed')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between flight distance and fuel consumption?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    cancellation_reason_counts = data['cancellation_reason'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(cancellation_reason_counts, labels=cancellation_reason_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    
    plt.title("What is the distribution of flight cancellations by reason?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data['day_of_week'] = data['date'].dt.day_name()
    
    ax = data.boxplot(column='departure_delay', by='day_of_week', grid=False)
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of flight delays by day of the week?')
    ax.set_xlabel('Day of Week')
    ax.set_ylabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.suptitle('')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
